DOCNAME: CASE OF BENET PRAHA, SPOL. S R.O.,  v. THE CZECH REPUBLIC
CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;No violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 2 of Protocol No. 1 - Control of the use of property);Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Constitutional proceedings;Article 6-1 - Fair hearing);Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient
JUDGES: Angelika Nußberger;Dean Spielmann;Elisabet Fura;Ganna Yudkivska;Karel Jungwiert
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant , ORG , spol . s r.o . , is a limited liability company incorporated under NORP law with its registered seat in GPE .
CARDINAL . DATE the applicant company dealt in ferrous alloys .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE customs authorities initiated a set of administrative proceedings against the applicant company in order to check the accuracy of the customs debt ( concerning customs plus VAT ) the company had paid during the aforementioned period of time .

CARDINAL . Simultaneously , criminal proceedings were instituted against a person , who was a manager ( jednatel ) of the applicant company during that period of time , on suspicion of tax evasion while he was managing the applicant company . According to the Government the damage caused to the ORG exceeded CARDINAL NORP korunas ( CZK ; CARDINAL ( ORG ) ) .

CARDINAL . Within the framework of the criminal proceedings a search of the applicant company 's LOC was carried out on DATE . Cash in several currencies in the total amount of MONEY ( EUR CARDINAL ) and several documents such as financial files , books of accounts and business documents were seized . According to the applicant company these documents and most of the cash have not yet been returned to it .

CARDINAL . Simultaneously with the criminal investigation , the customs and tax administrative proceedings resulted in the delivery of numerous payment orders assessing duty payable by the applicant company . With all of its assets frozen , the applicant company requested the prosecuting authorities on a number of occasions to lift the seizure in order to discharge these duties , but only few of these requests were granted . Its appeals did not suspend the effect of those orders payable within DATE of delivery . Consequently , the company had to take out a loan , among other measures adopted to overcome this situation , and avoid insolvency , as it was obliged to pay under these orders a sum totalling CZK CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) .

“ On DATE , when consulting the case file , I found that it should also include CARDINAL files [ covering the criminal proceedings ] submitted by ORG ... [ A]bout CARDINAL files annexed to the reply of ORG submitted upon ORG invitation of DATE were dispatched on DATE ... and delivered to ORG on DATE .

At the time of my study of the case file these QUANTITY files had been sent somewhere for consultation . ... I kindly ask you to set another date on which consultation of the case file including the aforesaid documentary evidence , will be possible . ”

CARDINAL . In a letter of CARDINAL DATE from ORG judge , the applicant company 's acting manager was told to make a direct approach to ORG to which the file in question had been returned . The same letter also informed the representative of the applicant company that he was free to inspect ORG file after arranging a visit to do this with the court 's registry .

CARDINAL . In a letter of CARDINAL DATE the applicant company 's acting manager asked ORG judge to remedy the situation and ensure the applicant company had access to those criminal files . The latter replied , on DATE , that pursuant to section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW , a party to the proceedings must be legally represented . He further stated that the criminal case file was not a ORG file , but subject to LAW , in particular LAW , which governs access to criminal files .
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant company 's constitutional appeal ( II . ÚS CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) . It held in particular :

“ As it appears from the decision refusing to lift the seizure of the assets , in the High Prosecutor 's view , to lift it could jeopardise the purpose of the criminal proceedings . ... [ ORG ] shared his opinion ... In its written observations , it found that there was no ground justifying the conclusion that the seizure of the [ applicant company 's ] assets ... was no longer necessary .

In the present case , ORG did not consider the conduct of the ORG authorities a misuse of law to the applicant company 's detriment , contrary to the basic requirements of fairness and of LAW . The mere fact that the applicant company was not successful in its request can not be in itself considered as violating its right to a fair trial . ”

CARDINAL . Upon the invitation of ORG , ORG and ORG submitted its written observations . ORG proposed that the applicant 's constitutional appeal be dismissed . It held that the seizure of the assets was still proportionate in view of the complexity of the investigation and in this context it considered important the assurance of ORG that the investigation should be finished DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found a violation of the right to property of a company , PERSON , spol . s r.o . , which was in the same position as the applicant company . It held that the length of the seizure , over DATE , was unreasonable , which thus disrupted the fair balance between the general interest of fighting serious crime and the protection of the rights of the applicant company . Consequently , the applicant company lodged another request for the seizure of its bank accounts to be lifted referring to this decision of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the High Prosecutor lifted the seizure of the applicant company 's bank accounts , holding that the conclusions of ORG also applied to the applicant company .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) provides that the applicant must be represented in the proceedings before ORG by an attorney .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provides that parties and joined parties are entitled to comment on a constitutional appeal , to make submissions to ORG , to consult a case file ( with the exception of records of voting ) , to make excerpts therefrom and copies thereof , to adduce any evidence , to take part in any oral hearing in the matter , and to assist at any taking of evidence .

CARDINAL . Under LAW , ORG must take all evidence necessary to establish the facts of the case . It decides what evidence submitted by parties should be accepted and may take evidence which has not been adduced by the parties . It may assign a judge to take evidence obtained otherwise than at an oral hearing , or request another court to take such evidence . At its request , courts , public administrative authorities and other ORG institutions must assist it in its decision - making by procuring documentary evidence . A record must be drawn up of all evidence taken outside an oral hearing , this record being signed by a judge , a clerk and other persons participating in that evidence session . The outcome of the taking of evidence must always be communicated at an oral hearing .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) provides that any means which may be instrumental to establish facts of a case may be used in evidence , in particular the testimony of witnesses , expert opinions , reports and statements of ORG authorities and legal persons , documents , outcomes of inquiries and the testimony of parties .

CARDINAL . Pursuant to Article CARDINAL , prosecuting authorities shall assess preliminary issues arising in course of proceedings ; should a final and binding decision on such an issue have already been adopted by a court or another state authority , prosecuting authorities shall be bound by it unless it concerns an issue of the guilt of the accused .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL provides for the rights of a concerned person . It states that anyone whose property has been seized or is liable to be seized following an application for seizure must be provided with an opportunity to comment on the given case , may attend a hearing , raise its own requests , consult the case file within the meaning of DATE , and lodge appeals as provided for by this law .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL concerns access to files . The first paragraph provides , inter alia , that the accused , injured and intervening parties , their counsel and guardians shall have the right of access to files except for records and those sections of records containing personal data of anonymous witnesses , to make excerpts and notes therefrom , and to have duplicates of the files and the parts thereof made at their own expense . Other persons may do so with the authorisation of a president of a chamber and a prosecutor , or with police authority at the pre - trial stage of proceedings if it is necessary for the exercise of their rights .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides for a seizure of financial instruments deposited on a bank account . If the given facts indicate that the financial instruments on a bank account are intended for the commission of a crime , or have already been used for such a purpose , or constitute profits from criminal activities , a president of a chamber and a prosecutor , or the police authority at the pre - trial stage of criminal proceedings , are empowered to seize them .

DATE . Pursuant to Article CARDINALa § CARDINAL , the ORG authority listed in paragraph CARDINAL lifts or reduces the seizure if such a measure is no longer necessary , or it is not necessary to maintain it at the given amount . A decision within the meaning of the previous sentence by police is subject to prior approval by a prosecutor .

CARDINAL . Under Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL the owner of a bank account whose assets are seized , has the right to request that the seizure be lifted or reduced . A prosecutor has to decide on such a request without delay .
CARDINAL . Article DATE provides that decisions adopted pursuant to paragraphs CARDINAL , CARDINAL and DATE may be appealed by a complaint .
CARDINAL . According to LAW a complainant may rely on new facts and evidence .

CARDINAL . Pursuant to LAW , if a decision is erroneous due to the fact that a part of its operative section is missing , an appellate authority is empowered either to amend the impugned decision , remit the case to the authority of first instance whose decision is challenged , for it to decide on the missing part of the decision or to amend it .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides that an appeal shall not suspend the entry into force of a decision adopted in administrative proceedings on tax and other fees unless a special law provides otherwise .
